from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.functions import *
from pyspark.sql.types import *
from notebookutils import mssparkutils
import logging
from datetime import datetime
from pyspark.sql.types import *  # This should include LongType
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType, DateType, IntegerType, LongType

# Configure logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO, format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s')
logger = logging.getLogger()

# Initialize Spark session with Delta Lake support
spark = SparkSession.builder \
    .appName("Voters Data Lake Export - PostgreSQL Schema") \
    .config("spark.sql.extensions", "io.delta.sql.DeltaSparkSessionExtension") \
    .config("spark.sql.catalog.spark_catalog", "org.apache.spark.sql.delta.catalog.DeltaCatalog") \
    .getOrCreate()

def clean_data_before_transformation(df):
    """
    Comprehensive data cleaning before PostgreSQL transformation
    """
    logger.info("Starting comprehensive data cleaning")
    
    initial_count = df.count()
    logger.info(f"Initial record count: {initial_count}")
    
    # Step 1: Remove records with NULL/empty lname or fname
    logger.info("Step 1: Filtering records with NULL/empty lname or fname")
    df = df.filter(
        (col("lname").isNotNull()) & 
        (trim(col("lname")) != "") & 
        (upper(trim(col("lname"))) != "NULL") &
        (upper(trim(col("lname"))) != "NA") &
        (upper(trim(col("lname"))) != "NAN") &
        (col("fname").isNotNull()) & 
        (trim(col("fname")) != "") & 
        (upper(trim(col("fname"))) != "NULL") &
        (upper(trim(col("fname"))) != "NA") &
        (upper(trim(col("fname"))) != "NAN")
    )
    
    after_name_filter = df.count()
    logger.info(f"Records after name filtering: {after_name_filter} (removed: {initial_count - after_name_filter})")
    
    # Step 2: Log address issues but don't filter
    logger.info("Step 2: Checking address quality (no filtering)")
    address_issues = df.filter(
        (col("address").isNull()) | 
        (trim(col("address")) == "") |
        (upper(trim(col("address"))) == "NULL") |
        (upper(trim(col("address"))) == "NA") |
        (upper(trim(col("address"))) == "NAN")
    ).count()
    
    logger.info(f"Found {address_issues} records with address issues (keeping all records)")
    
    # Step 3: Clean zip code duplicates from address fields
    logger.info("Step 3: Cleaning address2-5 - removing zip code duplicates")
    
    zip_duplicates_count = df.filter(
        (col("address2") == regexp_replace(col("zip"), " ", "")) |
        (col("address3") == regexp_replace(col("zip"), " ", "")) |
        (col("address4") == regexp_replace(col("zip"), " ", "")) |
        (col("address5") == regexp_replace(col("zip"), " ", ""))
    ).count()
    
    logger.info(f"Found {zip_duplicates_count} records with zip code duplicates in address fields")
    
    # Clean all address fields that match zip without spaces
    df = df.withColumn("address2",
        when(col("address2") == regexp_replace(col("zip"), " ", ""), lit(None))
        .otherwise(col("address2"))
    ).withColumn("address3",
        when(col("address3") == regexp_replace(col("zip"), " ", ""), lit(None))
        .otherwise(col("address3"))
    ).withColumn("address4",
        when(col("address4") == regexp_replace(col("zip"), " ", ""), lit(None))
        .otherwise(col("address4"))
    ).withColumn("address5",
        when(col("address5") == regexp_replace(col("zip"), " ", ""), lit(None))
        .otherwise(col("address5"))
    )
    
    logger.info(f"Cleaned zip code duplicates from {zip_duplicates_count} records")
    
    # Step 4: Remove "NAN" values from address4
    logger.info("Step 4: Removing 'NAN' values from address4")
    df = df.withColumn("address4", 
        when(upper(trim(col("address4"))) == "NAN", lit(None))
        .otherwise(col("address4"))
    )
    
    # Step 5: Address field reorganization - shift addresses that start with numbers
    logger.info("Step 5: Reorganizing address fields")
    
    # Step 6: Address4 cannot be empty - comprehensive address shifting
    logger.info("Step 6: Ensuring address4 is not empty through comprehensive shifting")
    
    # Shift address3 to address4 if address4 is null and address3 is not null
    df = df.withColumn("address4",
        when(
            (col("address4").isNull()) & 
            (col("address3").isNotNull()) &
            (trim(col("address3")) != ""),
            col("address3")
        ).otherwise(col("address4"))
    ).withColumn("address3",
        when(
            (col("address4") == col("address3")) & 
            (col("address4").isNotNull()),
            lit(None)
        ).otherwise(col("address3"))
    )
    
    # Shift address2 to address4 if address4 is still null and address2 doesn't start with number
    df = df.withColumn("address4",
        when(
            (col("address4").isNull()) & 
            (col("address2").isNotNull()) &
            (trim(col("address2")) != "") &
            (regexp_extract(trim(col("address2")), "^([0-9])", 1) == ""),  # doesn't start with number
            col("address2")
        ).otherwise(col("address4"))
    ).withColumn("address2",
        when(
            (col("address4") == col("address2")) & 
            (col("address4").isNotNull()),
            lit(None)
        ).otherwise(col("address2"))
    )
    
    # If address4 is still null, try address5 or address6
    df = df.withColumn("address4",
        when(
            (col("address4").isNull()) & 
            (col("address5").isNotNull()) &
            (trim(col("address5")) != ""),
            col("address5")
        ).when(
            (col("address4").isNull()) & 
            (col("address6").isNotNull()) &
            (trim(col("address6")) != ""),
            col("address6")
        ).otherwise(col("address4"))
    )
    
    # Step 7: Final cleanup - remove records that still have null address4
    logger.info("Step 7: Final cleanup - removing records with null address4")
    before_final_filter = df.count()
    df = df.filter(col("address4").isNotNull() & (trim(col("address4")) != ""))
    after_final_filter = df.count()
    logger.info(f"Records after final address4 filtering: {after_final_filter} (removed: {before_final_filter - after_final_filter})")
    
    # Step 8: Final cleanup - remove other NAN/NULL values
    logger.info("Step 8: Cleaning other NAN/NULL values")
    
    # Clean address fields
    for addr_col in ["address", "address2", "address3", "address4", "address5", "address6"]:
        df = df.withColumn(addr_col,
            when(upper(trim(col(addr_col))).isin(["NAN", "NULL", "NA", ""]), lit(None))
            .otherwise(col(addr_col))
        )
    
    # Clean other string fields
    for str_col in ["title", "new_marker", "flags", "perm_disqual", "source_id"]:
        if str_col in df.columns:
            df = df.withColumn(str_col,
                when(upper(trim(col(str_col))).isin(["NAN", "NULL", "NA", ""]), lit(None))
                .otherwise(col(str_col))
            )
    
    final_count = df.count()
    logger.info(f"Final record count after comprehensive cleaning: {final_count}")
    logger.info(f"Total records removed: {initial_count - final_count}")
    
    return df

def transform_to_postgresql_schema(df):
    """
    Transform DataFrame to match exact PostgreSQL juror_mod.voters schema
    Note: part_no will be NULL here as it's generated by PostgreSQL sequence
    """
    logger.info("Starting transformation to PostgreSQL schema")
    
    # Apply comprehensive data cleaning first
    df = clean_data_before_transformation(df)
    
    # Define the PostgreSQL staging schema structure (part_no will be NULL)
    postgresql_schema = StructType([
        StructField("part_no", StringType(), True),            # NULL - generated in PostgreSQL
        StructField("register_lett", StringType(), True),      # VARCHAR(5)
        StructField("poll_number", StringType(), True),        # VARCHAR(5)
        StructField("new_marker", StringType(), True),         # VARCHAR(1)
        StructField("title", StringType(), True),              # VARCHAR(10)
        StructField("lname", StringType(), False),             # NOT NULL, VARCHAR(20)
        StructField("fname", StringType(), False),             # NOT NULL, VARCHAR(20)
        StructField("dob", DateType(), True),                  # DATE
        StructField("flags", StringType(), True),              # VARCHAR(2)
        StructField("address", StringType(), False),           # NOT NULL, VARCHAR(35)
        StructField("address2", StringType(), True),           # VARCHAR(35)
        StructField("address3", StringType(), True),           # VARCHAR(35)
        StructField("address4", StringType(), True),           # VARCHAR(35)
        StructField("address5", StringType(), True),           # VARCHAR(35)
        StructField("address6", StringType(), True),           # VARCHAR(35)
        StructField("zip", StringType(), True),                # VARCHAR(10)
        StructField("date_selected1", DateType(), True),       # DATE
        StructField("date_selected2", DateType(), True),       # DATE
        StructField("date_selected3", DateType(), True),       # DATE
        StructField("rec_num", IntegerType(), True),           # INTEGER
        StructField("perm_disqual", StringType(), True),       # VARCHAR(1)
        StructField("source_id", StringType(), True),          # VARCHAR(1)
        StructField("postcode_start", StringType(), True),     # VARCHAR(10) - generated in PostgreSQL
        StructField("hash_id", LongType(), True)             # Keep hash_id for deduplication
    ])
    
    # Apply field length constraints and transformations
    logger.info("Applying field length constraints")
    
    df_constrained = df \
        .withColumn("part_no", lit(None).cast(StringType())) \
        .withColumn("register_lett", 
                   when(col("register_lett").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(col("register_lett")), 1, 5))) \
        .withColumn("poll_number", 
                   when(col("poll_number").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(col("poll_number")), 1, 5))) \
        .withColumn("new_marker", 
                   when(col("new_marker").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(col("new_marker")), 1, 1))) \
        .withColumn("title", 
                   when(col("title").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(col("title")), 1, 10))) \
        .withColumn("lname", 
                   substring(trim(upper(col("lname"))), 1, 20)) \
        .withColumn("fname", 
                   substring(trim(upper(col("fname"))), 1, 20)) \
        .withColumn("flags", 
                   when(col("flags").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(col("flags")), 1, 2))) \
        .withColumn("address", 
                   substring(trim(upper(col("address"))), 1, 35)) \
        .withColumn("address2", 
                   when(col("address2").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(upper(col("address2"))), 1, 35))) \
        .withColumn("address3", 
                   when(col("address3").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(upper(col("address3"))), 1, 35))) \
        .withColumn("address4", 
                   when(col("address4").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(upper(col("address4"))), 1, 35))) \
        .withColumn("address5", 
                   when(col("address5").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(upper(col("address5"))), 1, 35))) \
        .withColumn("address6", 
                   when(col("address6").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(upper(col("address6"))), 1, 35))) \
        .withColumn("zip", 
                   when(col("zip").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(upper(col("zip"))), 1, 10))) \
        .withColumn("perm_disqual", 
                   when(col("perm_disqual").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(col("perm_disqual")), 1, 1))) \
        .withColumn("source_id", 
                   when(col("source_id").isNull(), lit(None))
                   .otherwise(substring(trim(col("source_id")), 1, 1)))
    
    # Handle date fields - convert string dates to proper date type
    logger.info("Converting date fields")
    
    df_with_dates = df_constrained \
        .withColumn("dob", 
                   when(col("dob").isNull(), lit(None).cast(DateType()))
                   .when(col("dob") == "", lit(None).cast(DateType()))
                   .otherwise(to_date(col("dob"), "yyyy-MM-dd"))) \
        .withColumn("date_selected1", 
                   when(col("date_selected1").isNull(), lit(None).cast(DateType()))
                   .when(col("date_selected1") == "", lit(None).cast(DateType()))
                   .otherwise(to_date(col("date_selected1"), "yyyy-MM-dd"))) \
        .withColumn("date_selected2", 
                   when(col("date_selected2").isNull(), lit(None).cast(DateType()))
                   .when(col("date_selected2") == "", lit(None).cast(DateType()))
                   .otherwise(to_date(col("date_selected2"), "yyyy-MM-dd"))) \
        .withColumn("date_selected3", 
                   when(col("date_selected3").isNull(), lit(None).cast(DateType()))
                   .when(col("date_selected3") == "", lit(None).cast(DateType()))
                   .otherwise(to_date(col("date_selected3"), "yyyy-MM-dd")))
    
    # Set postcode_start to NULL (generated by PostgreSQL)
    logger.info("Setting postcode_start to NULL - will be generated by PostgreSQL")
    
    df_with_postcode = df_with_dates \
        .withColumn("postcode_start", lit(None).cast(StringType()))
    
    # Ensure rec_num is integer type
    df_with_rec_num = df_with_postcode \
        .withColumn("rec_num", 
                   when(col("rec_num").isNull(), lit(None).cast(IntegerType()))
                   .otherwise(col("rec_num").cast(IntegerType())))
    # Ensure hash_id is long type (bigint)
    df_with_hash = df_with_rec_num \
          .withColumn("hash_id", 
                      when(col("hash_id").isNull(), lit(None).cast(LongType()))
                      .otherwise(col("hash_id").cast(LongType())))
    
    # Select only the required columns in the correct order
    final_columns = [
        "part_no", "register_lett", "poll_number", "new_marker", "title",
        "lname", "fname", "dob", "flags", "address", "address2", "address3",
        "address4", "address5", "address6", "zip", "date_selected1",
        "date_selected2", "date_selected3", "rec_num", "perm_disqual",
        "source_id", "postcode_start", "hash_id"
    ]
    
    df_final = df_with_rec_num.select(*final_columns)
    
    # Final validation - check for any remaining NULL violations
    logger.info("Performing final validation")
    
    null_lname = df_final.filter(col("lname").isNull()).count()
    null_fname = df_final.filter(col("fname").isNull()).count()

    
    if null_lname > 0 or null_fname > 0:
        logger.warning(f"NULL constraint violations found: lname={null_lname}, fname={null_fname}")
        
        # Remove records with NULL violations only for empty lname or fname
        df_final = df_final.filter(
            col("lname").isNotNull() &
            col("fname").isNotNull() 
        )
    
    # Check hash_id uniqueness for deduplication verification
    unique_hash_ids = df_final.select("hash_id").distinct().count()
    total_records = df_final.count()
    
    if unique_hash_ids != total_records:
        logger.warning(f"Duplicate hash_ids found: {total_records - unique_hash_ids} duplicates")
        # Remove duplicates keeping the first occurrence
        from pyspark.sql.window import Window
        window_spec = Window.partitionBy("hash_id").orderBy(col("hash_id"))
        df_final = df_final.withColumn("row_num", row_number().over(window_spec)) \
                          .filter(col("row_num") == 1) \
                          .drop("row_num")
    
    logger.info(f"Final record count after PostgreSQL schema transformation: {df_final.count()}")
    
    return df_final

def filter_by_date_range(df, date_list=None):
    """
    Filter DataFrame by specific creation dates
    
    Args:
        df: Input DataFrame
        date_list: List of dates in YYYYMMDD format (as integers)
    
    Returns:
        Filtered DataFrame
    """
    if date_list is None or len(date_list) == 0:
        logger.info("No date filtering applied - returning all records")
        return df
    
    logger.info(f"Filtering records by creation dates: {date_list}")
    
    # Create filter condition for multiple dates
    date_conditions = None
    for date_val in date_list:
        condition = col("creation_date") == lit(date_val)
        if date_conditions is None:
            date_conditions = condition
        else:
            date_conditions = date_conditions | condition
    
    filtered_df = df.filter(date_conditions)
    
    filtered_count = filtered_df.count()
    logger.info(f"Records after date filtering: {filtered_count}")
    
    return filtered_df

def trim_last_columns(df, columns_to_remove=6):
    """
    Remove the last N columns from DataFrame
    
    Args:
        df: Input DataFrame
        columns_to_remove: Number of columns to remove from the end (default: 6)
    
    Returns:
        DataFrame with trimmed columns
    """
    logger.info(f"Trimming last {columns_to_remove} columns from DataFrame")
    
    # Get all column names
    all_columns = df.columns
    logger.info(f"Original columns ({len(all_columns)}): {all_columns}")
    
    # Keep all except the last N columns
    if len(all_columns) > columns_to_remove:
        columns_to_keep = all_columns[:-columns_to_remove]
    else:
        logger.warning(f"DataFrame has only {len(all_columns)} columns, cannot remove {columns_to_remove}")
        columns_to_keep = all_columns
    
    logger.info(f"Keeping columns ({len(columns_to_keep)}): {columns_to_keep}")
    
    # Select only the columns to keep
    trimmed_df = df.select(*columns_to_keep)
    
    return trimmed_df

def export_to_csv(df, output_path, filename_prefix="voters_export"):
    """
    Export DataFrame to CSV with proper formatting
    
    Args:
        df: DataFrame to export
        output_path: Base output path
        filename_prefix: Prefix for the CSV filename
    
    Returns:
        Path to the exported CSV file
    """
    logger.info(f"Starting CSV export to {output_path}")
    
    # Ensure output directory exists
    if not mssparkutils.fs.exists(output_path):
        logger.info(f"Creating output directory: {output_path}")
        mssparkutils.fs.mkdirs(output_path)
    
    # Create timestamp for unique filename
    timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
    
    # Write to temporary CSV folder
    temp_output_dir = f"{output_path}/temp_{timestamp}"
    
    logger.info(f"Writing to temporary directory: {temp_output_dir}")
    
    try:
        df.coalesce(1).write \
            .option("header", "true") \
            .option("quoteAll", "true") \
            .option("escape", "\\") \
            .mode("overwrite") \
            .csv(temp_output_dir)
        
        logger.info("CSV write completed, locating output file")
        
        # Locate and rename the .csv file
        files_written = mssparkutils.fs.ls(temp_output_dir)
        csv_found = False
        final_csv_path = None
        
        for f in files_written:
            if f.path.endswith(".csv") and "part-" in f.path:
                final_csv_path = f"{output_path}/{filename_prefix}_{timestamp}.csv"
                mssparkutils.fs.cp(f.path, final_csv_path)
                logger.info(f"üìÑ Exported to: {final_csv_path}")
                csv_found = True
                break
        
        # Check if a CSV file was found and copied
        if not csv_found:
            logger.error("‚ö†Ô∏è No CSV file was found in the output directory")
            final_csv_path = None
        
        # Clean up temp directory
        logger.info("Cleaning up temporary directory")
        mssparkutils.fs.rm(temp_output_dir, recurse=True)
        
        return final_csv_path
        
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error during CSV export: {str(e)}")
        # Clean up temp directory even on error
        try:
            mssparkutils.fs.rm(temp_output_dir, recurse=True)
        except:
            pass
        raise

def export_voters_to_postgresql_schema():
    """
    Main function to export voters data with PostgreSQL schema compliance and date filtering
    """
    try:
        # Initialize storage paths
        storage_account = "baubaisadfsaprod"
        source_path = f"abfss://dl-juror-eric-voters-temp@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/voters_deduplicated_delta"
        output_path = f"abfss://juror-etl@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/exports"
        
        # MANUAL DATE CONFIGURATION - MODIFY THESE VALUES AS NEEDED
        # Define your date range - update these dates manually as needed
        target_dates = [
            20241213,  # 2024-12-19
            # Add more dates as needed in YYYYMMDD format
        ]
        
        logger.info(f"Target dates for filtering: {target_dates}")
        
        # Read the existing Delta table
        logger.info(f"Reading voter data from {source_path}")
        source_df = spark.read.format("delta").load(source_path)
        
        initial_count = source_df.count()
        logger.info(f"Initial record count from Delta table: {initial_count}")
        
        # Filter by date range
        filtered_df = filter_by_date_range(source_df, target_dates)
        
        # Check if we have any records after filtering
        filtered_count = filtered_df.count()
        if filtered_count == 0:
            logger.warning("No records found for the specified date range")
            return None, None
        
        # Trim the last 6 columns
        filtered_trimmed_df = trim_last_columns(filtered_df, columns_to_remove=6)
        
        logger.info(f"Records ready for export: {filtered_trimmed_df.count()}")
        
        # Transform to PostgreSQL schema
        logger.info("Applying PostgreSQL schema transformation")
        postgresql_df = transform_to_postgresql_schema(filtered_trimmed_df)
        
        # Export to CSV
        logger.info("Exporting to CSV")
        csv_file_path = export_to_csv(
            postgresql_df, 
            output_path, 
            filename_prefix="voters_postgresql_export"
        )
        
        if csv_file_path:
            logger.info(f"‚úÖ Export completed successfully: {csv_file_path}")
            logger.info(f"üìä Final export statistics:")
            logger.info(f"   - Initial records: {initial_count}")
            logger.info(f"   - After date filtering: {filtered_count}")
            logger.info(f"   - Final exported records: {postgresql_df.count()}")
        else:
            logger.error("‚ùå Export failed - no CSV file created")
            
        return postgresql_df, csv_file_path
        
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error in PostgreSQL export process: {str(e)}")
        import traceback
        logger.error(traceback.format_exc())
        return None, None

# Execute the export with enhanced functionality
if __name__ == "__main__":
    logger.info("Starting Enhanced PostgreSQL Export Pipeline")
    
    result_df, csv_path = export_voters_to_postgresql_schema()
    
    if result_df is not None and csv_path is not None:
        logger.info("üéâ Enhanced PostgreSQL export pipeline completed successfully")
        logger.info(f"üìÅ CSV export location: {csv_path}")
        logger.info(f"üî¢ Total records exported: {result_df.count()}")
        
        # Show sample of the exported data
        logger.info("üìã Sample of exported data:")
        result_df.show(5, truncate=False)
        
    else:
        logger.error("üí• Enhanced PostgreSQL export pipeline failed")
